security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based MCP skill definition with no executable code. The SKILL.md contains only documentation describing the skill's purpose and workflow for updating project documents. No network calls, no external commands, no filesystem access beyond the documented document update operations.

content.value_statement: Keeping documentation in sync with code changes is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automates updates to specifications, database designs, error codes, and README files while preserving existing structure and markdown formatting.
actual_capabilities: Update feature specification documents in standard format
Maintain database design documentation with table schemas
Keep error code lists synchronized with code changes
Update README files across project directories
Preserve markdown formatting and document structure
limitations: Does not create new document types from scratch
Does not handle images or complex diagrams
Does not perform version control operations
Does not validate technical accuracy of content

use_cases.title: Database schema updates
use_cases.description: Update database design documents when adding new tables or modifying existing schemas.

use_cases.title: API specification maintenance
use_cases.description: Keep feature specifications synchronized with implemented functionality.

use_cases.title: README freshness
use_cases.description: Quickly update project README files with new features or usage instructions.

prompt_templates.title: Update feature spec
prompt_templates.prompt: update-docs document_type=feature feature_name=user-authentication update_content=Added POST /api/users/verify-email endpoint for email verification with rate limiting

prompt_templates.title: Add database table
prompt_templates.prompt: update-docs document_type=database update_content=Added sessions table for session management with 30-day expiration policy

prompt_templates.title: Register error code
prompt_templates.prompt: update-docs document_type=errors update_content=Added ERR_AUTH_TOKEN_EXPIRED (E401) - Triggered when JWT token exceeds max age

prompt_templates.title: Update project README
prompt_templates.prompt: update-docs document_type=readme update_content=Added Installation section with Docker compose instructions and environment variable setup

output_examples.input: update-docs document_type=readme update_content=Added Docker setup instructions to installation section
output: ‚úì Added Docker setup instructions to Installation section
Next: Review changes and commit when ready.

best_practices: Provide specific, focused update content rather than vague descriptions
Review markdown formatting after updates to ensure readability
Commit documentation changes alongside code changes for traceability
anti_patterns: Using the skill for large rewrites instead of incremental updates
Skipping the review step after documentation changes
Expecting the skill to validate technical accuracy of content

faq.question: Which document types are supported?
faq.answer: Feature specifications, database designs, error code lists, and README files in markdown format.

faq.question: Can I update any markdown file?
faq.answer: The skill follows project conventions for document paths. Custom paths require adjusting the skill configuration.

faq.question: Does it integrate with git?
faq.answer: No. The skill updates documents but does not commit. Use a separate git skill for version control operations.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only modifies specified document files within your project. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why did my update fail?
faq.answer: Common causes: invalid document path, markdown syntax errors, or file permission issues. Check the error message for details.

faq.question: How is this different from code generation?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on documentation updates only. Use code generation skills for implementing new features.
